author: sussman
msg: CAN-2004-0749: path-based authz fixes for svn 1.1.  Patch 6 of 6.
Create a new 'SVNPathAuthz' directive, which defaults to being 'On'.
If admins aren't using a path-based authz module (such as
mod_authz_svn), then this directive can be turned 'Off' -- it will
drastically speed up 'svn log', 'svn checkout', and possibly other
commands, by effectively disabling mod_dav_svn's read-authz callback.
* mod_dav_svn/mod_dav_svn.c
(dav_svn_dir_conf):  add new 'do_path_authz' flag to context.
(dav_svn_create_dir_config): set do_path_authz to TRUE by default.
(dav_svn_merge_dir_config): inherit new flag.
(dav_svn_pathauthz_cmd):  new func, parse value of SVNPathAuthz.
(dav_svn_get_pathauthz_flag): new func, fetch value of SVNPathAuthz.
(dav_svn_cmds):  register SVNPathAuthz directive.
* mod_dav_svn/dav_svn.h
(dav_svn_get_pathauthz_flag):  declare.
* mod_dav_svn/update.c
(dav_svn_authz_read):  if admin set 'SVNPathAuthz Off', then don't do
a subrequest;  just return success.
